Классный шутер, но уже олдскул. Отыграл в свое время в эту игру не мало часов, как на официалке, так и на пиратке.. Увы, было такое)))
Сейчас играю в CS:GO, на мой взгляд отличная вещь)

[b]*Ретро обзор[/b]

[h1]Не обзор, а скорее поток мыслей.[/h1]

[b]Я люблю иногда возвращаться к старым играм и проектам. Где-то интересно проследить прогресс, где-то просто забавно вернуться в состояние былых дней. Но "сурса" для меня это определенный вид развлечений.[/b]

[i]Такой контингент как здесь я нигде не встречал. Настолько точные представители эпохи прошлого, точно из пробирки.
Тут вам и Васяpro100нагибатор, и реальные пацаны, и мужики, отдыхающие в пятницу в 3 часа ночи под пиво.
Настолько забавно, насколько удивительно знать, что можно открыть телепорт в дни 10 летней давности лишь скачав старую CS.
Ну а как же продажа випок и админок по скидке?[/i]
[b]Всё на месте.

В 1.6 не играю, но допускаю, что там всё ещё веселее.[/b]
Güzel bi oyun ama  CS GO almanızı tavsiye ederim.

Pure FPS pleasure. I will probably never stop playing this game. Given there's a lot of cheats/hacking going on, but its simple enough to be run on most configurations, which cannot be said about a lot of recent FPS.

Considering the not-particularly-inviting CS:S community of players aren't really too accepting of novice players (like myself, a rubbish competitive FPS/anything player), CS:S only really acts as Gmod DLC for most people.

$10 DLC that costs just as much as the game did. Then again, since most content used in a good deal of servers comes from this overpriced DLC pack, you are getting your money's worth. Sort of. 

Get it on sale or in a bundle with Gmod. At least that way you'll save some money.

Aaah the clasic. This game, right now, is only worth buying if you are getting the bundle for Garry's mod.

This is my CS: S life story.....

     I was a young 5th grader and one of my friends had Garry's Mod at school. So the next day I started watching Garry's Mod videos and I totally fell in love with it. So the next weekend I told my dad about it. " Dad, there's this cool game that I want. It's called Garry's Mod. You think I can get it?" I said. " Well let me look at it." He replied. So after he was done looking at he said to me, "Buddy, you need a Source game for this to work." "Well, how much is a source game?" I replied. "20 dollars." (he was looking at CS:S) so the next time I got the money to afford, I got the games.  I instantly installed both of them and launched Garry's Mod right away. It kept me busy for a few weeks, but then the worst thing happened.... Boredem. So as I scrolled through my games I saw it; Counter Strike: Source. I was bored so I said that I'll give it a shot. So I joined a server that was hosting the office map (At this point in time I didn't know it was a popular map.) When I first got into the game I was in a garage. I looked up at the mission objective. It said something along the lines of, "Secure all the hostages in the hostage rescue zone." I then told my team that this was my first time playing. I fellow teammate told me to buy a P90. I followed his instructions as he told me to follow him. Once my team pushed the Terrorists back, there was a hall that had a couple of guys in it. My friend told him to do what he did. He ran out and sprayed his P90 he got one guy, but the other to murdered him. I was furious of watching my instructor/friend die. I then did exactly what he told me to do, "Spray n' pray." So I jumped out of cover and sprayed them down, watching their own blood spurt out of themselves. My first 2 kills. I felt so alive. But sadly the next corner I did it, I got shot and died because I ran out of ammo. Right when I died, I heard my buddy say, "That's how you do it, man!" So I played a little more until I had to go. I told my friend thank you and that he helped me alot. I really wish that I knew about the friending system (I only got Steam for Garry's Mod.) But that day and that friend, was what lit the spark for my desire of Counter Strike. I would have more hours on this game, but CS: GO came out shortly. That's why I have about 500 hours on it. But this, was my CS: S life story.

Хорошая игруха, играю уже 5 лет и не надоела!

I've played this game with my friends and we all had a lot of fun, mostly with all of the strange rules you can implement and user-made maps to test, like, for example, TV-Tower which is a large tower where the terrorists spawn at the top and the counter-terrorists have three ways of getting up: 1. an elevator [or lift in the UK] which brings you right to the terrorists spawn [which is not good unless you have a distraction] 2. the stairs on the outside which take FOREVER to climb but when you do you are at a major advantage, and 3. ... the helicopter at CT spawn which takes you to the roof where there is a ladder you can use to get into the building. I know this was all focused on one map but there are many more to explore, even I havent explored even a quarter of the maps you can get. The one thing I disliked was how over powered some guns were. [IE: The AK-47 is two shots to an arm or a leg and the enemy is dead, while using pinpoint accuracy. or the C4 glitch where you can ninja defuse [defuse the bomb as a CT with out anyone knowing] through a wall. Overall I HIGHLY recomend this game to the reader.
The game runs well and is fun, but gets boring and repetitive after a while. If running around and shooting other players for hours on end is your cup of tea, buy this game. If not, stay far away.

Разумеется, Counter-Strike: Source — это ни в коем случае не Counter-Strike 2. О каких-то по-настоящему радикальных изменениях или новшествах и речи нет. По сути, мы получили прежнюю игру, завернутую в новую красивую упаковку. И, вы не поверите, именно этого и ждали фанаты CS. Из увлекательного сетевого экшена с паршивой графикой CS превратился в столь же увлекательный сетевой экшен, только с отличной и вполне себе современной графикой. Уже сейчас понятно, что Counter-Strike: Source ждет долгая и счастливая жизнь.

1. Decent computer (This runs well on a lot of computers)
2. Good aim
3. Fun

+ cs_office
+ Classic maps
+ Very casual

- $5 more than CS:GO... (Buy this on a sale!)
